description: This file contains a command-line utility built with Typer for converting Excel spreadsheets related to a graph-based ETL process into JSON seed files. The utility supports multiple commands for processing role abbreviations, competency definitions, requirement matrices, and adjacency matrices, with functions for reading Excel files, normalizing data, and outputting JSON files for downstream use.

methods.name: str _canon(name: str)
methods.description: Returns a canonical, comparable version of a string by converting to lowercase and keeping only alphanumeric characters.

methods.name: Dict[str,str] _build_lookup(df: pd.DataFrame)
methods.description: Builds a mapping from a canonical column name to the actual DataFrame column name.

methods.name: Optional[str] _find_col(lookup: Dict[str, str], candidates: List[str])
methods.description: Finds the first matching column in the lookup based on a list of candidate names.

methods.name: Dict[str,Optional[str]] _require_mapping(df: pd.DataFrame, spec: Dict[str, List[str]], required_keys: List[str])
methods.description: Resolves a mapping from logical keys to actual DataFrame column names, ensuring required keys are present.

methods.name: pd.DataFrame _read_excel(path: Path, sheet: Optional[str] = None)
methods.description: Reads an Excel file and returns a DataFrame.

methods.name: Optional[str] _opt_str(val)
methods.description: Converts a value to an optional string, returning None for NaN or blank.

methods.name: Optional[float] _opt_float(val)
methods.description: Converts a value to an optional float.

methods.name: None _ensure_out_dir(path: Path)
methods.description: Ensures the output directory exists, creating it if necessary.

methods.name: None _write_json(path: Path, payload: List[dict])
methods.description: Writes a list of dictionaries to a JSON file with indenting and UTF-8 encoding.

methods.name: None _summarize(path_in: Path, path_out: Path, count: int)
methods.description: Outputs a message indicating how many records were written to the output file.

methods.name: Path _resolve_output(output_dir: Path, default_name: str)
methods.description: Resolves the full output path based on the output directory and default filename.

methods.name: str _norm_role_name(name: str)
methods.description: Normalizes role names for fuzzy matching (lowercase, alphanumeric).

methods.name: str _abbr_fallback(name: str)
methods.description: Creates a fallback ID from a role name, using initials or PascalCase.

methods.name: Dict[str,str] _load_role_abbreviation_map(mapping_xlsx: Path)
methods.description: Loads 'Role abbreviations' from an Excel sheet into a mapping from normalized role names to abbreviations.

methods.name: str _match_role_to_abbr(role_name: str, abbr_map: Dict[str, str])
methods.description: Maps a role display name to a standard abbreviation ID, using exact or heuristic matching, with fallback.

methods.name: None roles_from_abbrev( input_file: str = typer.Argument(..., help="Excel file containing a 'Role abbreviations' sheet."), output_dir: str = typer.Option("data/processed", help="Directory to write roles.json"), )
methods.description: Converts role abbreviations from an Excel sheet into a JSON file mapping role IDs to role names.

methods.name: None competencies_from_definitions( input_file: str = typer.Argument(..., help="Excel file containing a 'Competency Definitions' sheet."), sheet: Optional[str] = typer.Option("Competency Definitions", help="Sheet name with competency definitions"), output_dir: str = typer.Option("data/processed", help="Directory to write competencies.json"), )
methods.description: Converts a 'Competency Definitions' sheet into a JSON list of competencies.

methods.name: None requires_from_matrix( input_file: str = typer.Argument(..., help="Excel file containing a matrix sheet (default: 'Competencies and roles')."), sheet: Optional[str] = typer.Option("Competencies and roles", help="Sheet name with competency vs role abbreviation columns"), output_dir: str = typer.Option("data/processed", help="Directory to write requires.json"), )
methods.description: Converts a competency-role matrixExcel sheet into JSON indicating required levels.

methods.name: None adjacency_from_matrix( input_file: str = typer.Argument(..., help="Excel file containing a square adjacency matrix (rows/columns = roles)."), sheet: Optional[str] = typer.Option(None, help="Sheet name (defaults to first sheet)"), mapping_xlsx: Optional[str] = typer.Option( None, help="Optional workbook with 'Role abbreviations' to map full names to ids (e.g., Competency_mapping.xlsx)" ), output_dir: str = typer.Option("data/processed", help="Directory to write adjacency.json"), use_upper_triangle_only: bool = typer.Option(True, help="Avoid duplicates by emitting only one direction per pair"), )
methods.description: Converts a square adjacency matrix of roles into JSON edges, optionally mapping roles to abbreviations and avoiding duplicates.

methods.name: str to_id(display_name: str)
methods.description: unavailable

ctags.name: _require_mapping
ctags.pattern: /^def _require_mapping(df: pd.DataFrame, spec: Dict[str, List[str]], required_keys: List[str]) -> /
ctags.signature: (df: pd.DataFrame, spec: Dict[str, List[str]], required_keys: List[str])

ctags.name: _summarize
ctags.pattern: /^def _summarize(path_in: Path, path_out: Path, count: int) -> None:$/

ctags.name: adjacency_from_matrix
ctags.signature: ( input_file: str = typer.Argument(..., help="Excel file containing a square adjacency matrix (rows/columns = roles)."), sheet: Optional[str] = typer.Option(None, help="Sheet name (defaults to first sheet)"), mapping_xlsx: Optional[str] = typer.Option( None, help="Optional workbook with 'Role abbreviations' to map full names to ids (e.g., Competency_mapping.xlsx)" ), output_dir: str = typer.Option("data/processed", help="Directory to write adjacency.json"), use_upper_triangle_only: bool = typer.Option(True, help="Avoid duplicates by emitting only one direction per pair"), )

ctags.name: app
ctags.pattern: /^app = typer.Typer(add_completion=False, help="Excel (.xlsx\/.xls) to normalized JSON converter f/

ctags.name: competencies_from_definitions
ctags.signature: ( input_file: str = typer.Argument(..., help="Excel file containing a 'Competency Definitions' sheet."), sheet: Optional[str] = typer.Option("Competency Definitions", help="Sheet name with competency definitions"), output_dir: str = typer.Option("data/processed", help="Directory to write competencies.json"), )

ctags.name: requires_from_matrix
ctags.signature: ( input_file: str = typer.Argument(..., help="Excel file containing a matrix sheet (default: 'Competencies and roles')."), sheet: Optional[str] = typer.Option("Competencies and roles", help="Sheet name with competency vs role abbreviation columns"), output_dir: str = typer.Option("data/processed", help="Directory to write requires.json"), )

ctags.name: roles_from_abbrev
ctags.signature: ( input_file: str = typer.Argument(..., help="Excel file containing a 'Role abbreviations' sheet."), output_dir: str = typer.Option("data/processed", help="Directory to write roles.json"), )

fields.name: app = typer.Typer(add_completion=False, help="Excel (.xlsx\/.xls) to normalized JSON converter f/
